Dialogue: Sorry, Im just a little tired.

Dialogue: They're okay. They don't get me. I mean, they're alright.

Dialogue: Since seven years. He's a painter.

Dialogue: Houses. He's a pig. He talks but he doesn't think. You go to college?

Dialogue: Um, I had to drop out. I had a problem with drinkin' and stuff. I'll go back. I just gotta prove to my parents that I can fly staright. You go to college?

Dialogue: No, I was afraid I'd lose Phil if I went. Now that'd be reason enough to go. I saw you in the store and I liked how you kept to yourself. I can see in your eyes that you hate the world. I hate it too. You know what I'm talkin' about?

Dialogue: After livin in the dark for so long a glimspe of the light can make you giddy. Strange thought come into your head and you'd better think 'em. Or are you goin' to the grave with unlived lives in your vains?

Dialogue: Teeny, you're pretty. Bubba, isn't Teeny pretty?

Dialogue: Dear Justine. Because of you I'll be quitting the Retail Rodeo. The last two days have been the most god-awful days of my life. I've not been able to get rid of you in my head. The idea of being gotten, because of circumstance, will never get got is the worst feeling I've ever felt, and I have felt many bad feelings. I'm sorry I can never see you again, Justine, forgive me for being so weak, but that is who I am. Goodbye, Holden Wurther. If for some reason, you could change your mind and want to be with me, body and soul, meet me after work. I will be waiting for you at five PM outside Chuck E.Cheese. Dialogue: Your stories are intense.

Dialogue: I just wanna leave some kind of legacy. Somethin' great. After that I don't care what happens to me.

Dialogue: Don't say that. I wish there was a story about me. I don't know who would read it though.

Dialogue: I would.

Dialogue: I like this. I like havin' a secret. You gave me a secret Holden.

Dialogue: Seee, now that you met me you're mysterious. And dark and twisted.

Dialogue: I don't know.

Dialogue: If he finds out about us....

Dialogue: I won't let him hurt you.

Dialogue: He's big, Holden. He'll kill you. He'll beat me, but he'll kill you.

Dialogue: I gotta go to the hospital.

Dialogue: Okay.

Dialogue: Oh. I can't believe she's dead. I wasn't a very good friend to her.

Dialogue: Retail Rodeo employees this is Jack Fields, your store manager. Before we open today, I just want to share some terrible and shocking news. Now, if any of y'all need to collect you thoughts and remember Gwen. GWEN, then today's the day. You'll be excused from work and we'll just have to do without you. Gwen, this one's for you.

Dialogue: Holden had the notion to go to Gabler's Creek, skinny dippin' and makin' love. He said we'd be like Adam and Eve, rollin' around around in the sticks and the dirt and bein' one with nature. He was so fixed on the idea thateven when the clouds started rollin' in, and the sky was gettin; dark, he kept on swimmin'. All my thoughts turned to death. I thought of Gwen's body, rottin' away. I thought of how nice a person she was, so full of life and good will. If there was a heaven, Gwen would be there. Givin' makeovers and offerin' up helpful advice. I thought if I died today, what would happen to me? A hateful girl. A selfish girl. An adultress. A liar.

Dialogue: What are we doin'?

Dialogue: Makin' one out of two.

Dialogue: I haven't thought this through.

Dialogue: And go where?

Dialogue: Away. With you on my arm, my folks'll think I've changed. They'll stop thinkin' I'm suck a loner, I got a girlfriend, a pretty one, who knows me and likes me. And they'll be so happy, they'll give me money to write my novel.

Dialogue: But where will we GO?

Dialogue: We'll be like... Catcher in the Rye. Only by me. I'll be immortal and then like JD Salinger I'll just vanish.

Dialogue: So I heard about your friend bein' dead, and all. I'm sorry.

Dialogue: Well, at least you were with her when she went.  Ain't that right? You were... with her, when she went?

Dialogue: Yeah.

Dialogue: Fine.

Dialogue: Real shocker. I decided to move Cheryl over to cosmetics. She got a little too creative on the P.A. Maybe she'll watch her P's and Q's over here. If not she's out on her but. Now you listen to Justine, sister.

Dialogue: Just let the other people do the talking.

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: Jeez. We forgot the Bibles, Justine.

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: Well, that's alright, they'll forgive us.

Dialogue: Hi. Welcome. Hey there people! Glad you could make it!

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: Hi Corny. This is my husband, Phil.

Dialogue: Y'all are in for a treat. We got a good discussion going tonight. If man is made in God's image, what does that say about God?

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: Yeah, that sounds like a good one.

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: Phil, come with me to the car.

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: Come with me to the car, I gotta get somethin'.

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: What's goin' on?

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: Just get in the car. Get in the car, Phil.

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: What the hell?

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: I don't want to go to Bible study.

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: Because I don't want to. Now, can we please just get out of here?

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: Justine, this is embarassing. We're runnin' away from Bible study like a couple of Devil worshippers.

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: I don't care. I'm not in the mood.

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: You are freakin' me out, man. Why?

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: Why? Beacause we forgot our Bibles is why.

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: You just said a few minutes ago they'll forgive us.

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: Yeah, well, they may not, alright. So can we please just get the shit outta here?

Speaker: phil
Dialogue: I'm never goin' back to Bible study again.

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: I don't care, fine by me.

Dialogue: I think I look too white, don't you think?

Speaker: cheryl
Dialogue: I'm just tryin' to match your face with your hair, I was thinkin' you're not white enough.

Speaker: customer
Dialogue: I think I look kinda wierd.

Dialogue: Well, the first rule of fashion is that you have to look wierd. What I'm doing here has come straight from France.

Dialogue: Oh.

Speaker: customer
Dialogue: Well, you're the professoinal.

Dialogue: That's right.

Dialogue: Oh geez, we forgot our Bibles.

Dialogue: You coulda looked off your neighbor. It's a church, you know. You can't make water without bumpin' your nut on a bible.

Dialogue: Do you like it?

Dialogue: What came up?

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: Um, okay. I think, maybe, somebody's found out about us.

Speaker: holden
Dialogue: I'm starting to wonder if you even want to go. I'm startin' to think you don't get me.

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: Well, maybe I don't get you.

Speaker: holden
Dialogue: You do, you do get me you just don't want to me 'cause I'm too intensified for you! Justine, who cares, who cares if someone finds out. We don't have to live like this, Justine. I know what it's like to go home every night and feel like you're hidin' out. We can leave all this behind...

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: That's easy for you to say, Holden, you are not married.

Speaker: holden
Dialogue: You just, you just gonna give up?! You gonna go crawlin' back?!

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: Holden, you are gonna get us caught!

Speaker: holden
Dialogue: You're so fucking afraid it makes me sick. Don't give up on us.

Dialogue: I won't.

Dialogue: I'll see you tomorrow, okay? Okay?

Dialogue: Okay. Good luck on your important thing.

Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: bubba
Dialogue: Easy Bitz, easy Bitz. Back in your corner! Back in your corner! Back in your corner, Bitz! Come on in. I wanna show you somethin'. Sit.  I'm in shock.

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: bubba
Dialogue: You know why.

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: Bubba sat like that for what seemed like ten years before he began to speak. Finally, when he opened his mouth, he talked a blue streak about the ruin that was his life. He talked about how he loved Phil, and how he loved me. And how he always wanted a girlfriend just like me, and to be a guy like Phil, to this imaginary girl like me, that he never found. Then he wen on about givin' up your dreams and how it's all a part of gettin' older. Bubba had given up on his dream to be like Phil, and accepted his fate as Bubba, always and forever. Then, last week, a door that remained shut swung wide open. Bubba thought this no chance coincidence, a cosmic force was at work. The sounds of me makin' love to a man that wasn't Phil was like a shout in Bubba's ear from the creator himself. What it meant, or what to do, or why Bubba didn't know. All he knew was that he hated me for poisoning the well of idealism that he had drunk from for so long. I was no longer Bubba's image of perfection. To him I was just a liar, and a whore, and that sickened him. But on the other hand he loved me for opening his eyes and releasing him from the bitter chains of evny that bound him to Phil. Phil was no superman, just a cuckhold, and a foll, and that was beautiful. Bubba felt that there was just one thing left for us to do. Something that would solve both our problems and end this whole tragic cycle.

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: Bubba, I am not gonna sleep with you.

Speaker: bubba
Dialogue: But don't you see? This is my chance, for liberation.

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: But, one person's liberation is another person's, well, badness. There's just no way.

Speaker: bubba
Dialogue: I'm gonna have to tell Phil then.

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: bubba
Dialogue: He's my best friend. I can't keep him in the dark about somethin' this big. He's a cuckhold.

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: You wanna cuckhold him yourself!

Dialogue: Well that's different. That isn't about him. That's about my salvation. Look, you've got your choice to make. Either destroy your marriage, and break your husband's heart. Or have sex with me right now.

Dialogue: Oh god! There was someone in the window! Did you not see?

Speaker: bubba
Dialogue: You're paranoid.

Dialogue: I gotta go.

Dialogue: Phil is never gonna find out about any of this. Don't fret.

Dialogue: Get this damn dog away from me!

Dialogue: Great. Good for you.

Dialogue: Thank you.

Dialogue: I'm nervous.

Dialogue: Okay.

Dialogue: Oh. Is it? Thanks.

Dialogue: You're welcome.

Dialogue: No, we don't.

Dialogue: You've gotta get a hold of yourself! Are you drunk?

Dialogue: Oh... I, I promise.

Dialogue: I realized then that Holden was at best a child, and at worst a demon. If I was ever gonna go straight I'd have to ditch him. Sometimes, to get back on the road to redemption, you have to make a few pit stops.

Dialogue: How much are the blackberries?

Dialogue: Thank you.

Dialogue: Have a blackberry, Holden!

Dialogue: But, they're dirty.  What...? What was that for?

Dialogue: I'm worried about Holden. Tom. I'm worried about Tom. I just befriended Tom, recently, and now, well, I think he's mentally ill. And, and I just think he would be better off in a place where people, professionals, could take care of him. Otherwise, he's just gonna get himself in trouble.

Dialogue: ALRIGHT!

Dialogue: And tomorrow, we're gonna celebrate at Senor Tuna. Yes we are. I'm gonna bring Bubba. You can bring some of your friends from work. Or Bible study guy. Whoever. Too bad Gwen's dead.

Dialogue: The test could be wrong, Phil. It's a little early to be havin' a party.

Dialogue: Suit yourself.

Dialogue: Hi, Justine. Go ahead and have a seat.

Dialogue: Justine, you like workin' at the Retail Rodeo don't you? Like the company, like the people? You wouldn't want to jeopardize that by makin' some silly error in judgement would ya?

Dialogue: Holden stole fifteen thousand dollars from the safe last night. Did you have anything to do with it?

Dialogue: No. I don't know anything.

Dialogue: 'Cause we know you're pretty tight with Holden.

Dialogue: I hardly know him.

Dialogue: I've seen you in the store room with him Justine. On many the occasion. I think you know him pretty well.

Dialogue: I don't know anything.

Dialogue: Justine! Justine!

Dialogue: I did it! I finally did somethin'!

Dialogue: Holden, the police are lookin' for you!

Dialogue: Oh, who cares? I'm proud of myself. Fuck them, Fuck all of them!

Dialogue: Hey! They think that I'm in on it, too! Corny's got a camera in that storage room. That Bible thumpin' pervert's been watchin' us the whole time.

Dialogue: Well, we're outta here! Justine, I got over twenty thousand dollars! I got a gun, what else?!

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: I'm gettin' all goosey. I think I'm gonna crash.  I'm pregnant, Holden.

Dialogue: It's my baby.

Dialogue: Not necessarily.

Dialogue: Yes, it is. You know it is.

Dialogue: Even if it is, you cannot raise a baby on the run.

Dialogue: Yes, you can. I mean, you can't raise a baby here. You know that. Justine. You hate your husband. You hate your job. You love me, so let's go.

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: I can't go tonight. I gotta pack my things and I'd have to get more money.

Speaker: holden
Dialogue: Well, then tomorrow. I'll go to the motel and wait for you. Just be there by noon.

Dialogue: This is all going too fast.

Dialogue: Justine, what have you got to lose?

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: Nothin'.

Dialogue: So be there by noon.

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: Okay.

Dialogue: I love you, Justine. This is all gonna work out. I know it. I almost forgot. This is a story of your life. You inspired me.

Dialogue: Hey.

Dialogue: No. That just means they got it wrong, is all. They don't know everything.

Dialogue: They just got it wrong, so...

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: How it all came down to this, only the devil knows. Retail Rodeo was at the corner on my left, the motel was down the road to my right. I closed my eyes and tried to peer into the future. On my left I saw days upon days of lipstick and ticking clocks. Dirty looks and quiet whisperings. and burning secrets that won't ever die away. And on my right, what could I picture? The blue sky, the desert earth streching out into the eerie infinity. A beautiful, never ending nothing.

Dialogue: Hey Justine.

Dialogue: I know where you can find him.

Dialogue: Holden?

Dialogue: He's at the Hotel Glen Capri, and he'll be there till noon.

Dialogue: I thought we were robbed. Why aren't you at work?

Dialogue: No.

Like dozens of those who quit. This one's for you Holden.

Dialogue: I was just at your house and the mail came. Phil was opening letters, and he opened this bill from the credit card company. And F&$%. Please don't tell him about us, Justine. Please. Please. I love Phil. I love him more than myself. Please have mercy on me.

Dialogue: Hey Phil.

Speaker: justine
Dialogue: That day I read the story Holden wrote for me. It was kinda different from the other one, but kinda the same. It was about a woman who was put upon. Whose job was a prison, and whose life had lost all meaning. Other people don't get her, especially her husband. One day she meets a boy who is also put upon, and they fall in love. After spending their whole lives not getting got, with one look they get eachother completely. In the end, the boy and the girl run away together in the wilderness, never to be heard from again.
